title: Leave game without getting caught?
body:
The story begins like this: Meet a troll in queue. He instalocked but fcked up real bad in lane so he afk (We all thought that he afk). After the game, it shows that he's name was in red which means that he dced and probably start another game. BUT the strange thing is that there was no announcement (XXX player has disconnected) that he dced (not even in chat) during the game which make us think that he afk instead of dc. 

I remember this troll name in the past and he also leave that game. I was a bit surprised that after he left that game and got reported, he was still playing but this time without any announcement that he had left the game. So I was wondering if there was some sort of trick that people can use to constantly leave game without getting caught by the system.

replies.body:
You still get caught by the system, no matter what you do. The only exception is if there are major server-wide issues and in that case everyone will get loss prevented (it would also be announced).

Riot understand that emergencies occasionally do happen, and even though you may not be punished for leaving one game (unless ranked which is treated more harshly), it is still recorded as a mark against your account. 
Players that are caught out by the leaver buster system are placed in something called a "Low Priority Queue", and must wait some time before joining queue. This time may change from 5minutes up to 20 minutes depending on how much you leave.

You can read more about the leaverbuster system [HERE](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714-LeaverBuster-FAQ#h2q1)
I don't believe that you can start another game if you are assigned to one in progress.

You can get marked as a leaver/AFKer without actually disconnecting from a match. If they were truly AFK (still connected but not moving/doing anything) then that would've still been picked up by the system, hence why their name was red in the post-game lobby.
